choices: There are a few extra items (Easy)
There are a lot of extra items (God Chosen)
1.content:
You're not sure what happened. One minute you're cruising down the blacktop on your new bike, the next there a clap of thunder, a flash of pitch black, and you are staring at your bike in pieces next to a cobblestone road. Once you check your body, you would find that you are relatively unharmed, though you feel like you've ran a marathon.

Groaning you would quickly do a head shoulders knees and toes to check your vitals and to make sure all parts were still attached. Sighing in relief you would begin to look over the wreckage of your bike groaning at your cursed luck.

"I still haven't even made the first payment," you mutter as you try and see if there is anything salvageable from the wreckage....
1.title: Well that just happened

choices: North (Forest, City of Elves and Fae)
Stay Put (Someone or Something will find you)
11.content:
There is little more than a scorch mark beside where you stand. When you say you look over the wreckage, you mean you look over the tiny pieces of shrapnel that once was your bike. Anything that would have been usable had long since gone up in flames or had been warped beyond all recognition.

Spitting you would curse your luck, "Of all the ways to start a day...."

Even after tediously searching for any useful item you would have to give way to the fact that there was nothing usable.

"Only one thing left to do then..." you sigh.

As you turn your attention back to the cobblestone road, you would notice that it runs East to West. North of the cobblestone road there is a Forest that could probably provide you with nuts and berries. To the South, as far as the eye can see there is Plains. You know you have to pick a direction, but which way do you go?
11.title: There is nothing (Hard)

choices: You see something that makes you run the other way
111.content:
You decide that East would be the appropriate choice.

Beginning the journey east was a rather pleasant ordeal. There was a slight breeze blowing and the temperature was around seventy-five degrees, perfect for light stroll. You noted that it was mid-morning, and slightly cloudy, though it didn't feel humid, so rain was out of the question. You traveled in silence mostly, perhaps humming a tune or muttering every once in while, until you notice something. That something is....
111.title: East (City of Humans and Dwarves)

1111.content:
As you would arrive you would notice the unusually massive walls come into view on the horizon. This would be your first indicator that this isn't your world. As you would approach a little closer you would note that there were four human guards standing at the entrance of the gate. Their metal armor shines in the sunlight with a freshly polished glint. You would also notice that these guards were all women. The blue and white banner sigil is emblazoned upon their breastplates.

Once you were within earshot, one of these female guards would shout out to you, "Halt, who goes there."
1111.title: You arrive at the city

11111.content:
You would stop as the barking tone of the woman throws you off. This is clearly a woman who takes her job seriously and was not one to mess with. The sword at her hip also helped your lips find the words you needed and in a respectful tone you would call out,

"My name is _______ ! I was in wreck up the road and need to find out where I am."

The woman would look you over and weigh her options. She almost seems to be deciding whether to trust your words or not.
11111.title: Answer

choices: North (Forest, City of Elves and Fae)
Stay Put (Someone or Something will find you)
12.content:
You sigh in relief as you see that your backpack was flung just off the road. You would quickly grab it and open it to see the following contents:

1. 50 foot cord
2. Knife
3. A change of clothes
4. A small umbrella
5. Your camel back
6. Your packed Lunch
7. A small blanket
8. Your wallet with all items in there
9. First aid Kit
10. A camping kit (few granola and trail bars)

"Thank God I was planning a camping trip this weekend," you would mutter as you hoisted the bag onto your back. Looking back to the road you would see that the road runs east to west, with plains to the south and forest to the north. Sighing you would pick a direction...
12.title: There are a few Items (Medium)

choices: From the east (You see a knight)
From the North (You see a mounted bandit)
From the South (You see a Centaur)
From the West (You see a Halfling Rider)
125.content:
Before you could even make a decision on which way to go you would hear the galloping of hooves getting louder. Looking around you would sigh in relief thinking that there is someone else around here that would be able to help you out.

Looking about, you would spot the source of the noise coming from....
125.title: Stay Put (Someone or Something will find you)

choices: She would call out to you (Friendly)
She would call out to you (Stern)
1253.content:
As you saw the creature before you, you could hardly believe your eyes. The centaur, or to be more accurate, the 'centauress' stood at least 8 feet off the ground dwarfing your 5 foot frame. You felt your mouth part in surprise as your eyes went over her body, trying to come to grips with the fact that a mythological being in front of you.

After your moment of stupor you would realize that she was trotting towards you. Like you had noted earlier she seemed to be 8 to 8 1/2 feet tall by your calculation. Her tan skin went well with her light brown horse body, paint in style, but larger. She had a rope in her hands as she was approaching you and....
1253.title: From the South (You see a Centaur)

choices: She laughs, she was pulling your leg (Comedy)
She offers to be your escort (Stern but understanding)
12532.content:
"Human" you would hear sternly from her, "What have we told you about taking this road without a proper escort!"

You didn't know what she was talking about, naturally because for you, 'she' wasn't supposed to exist in your world or perhaps... you aren't supposed to exist in hers.

"I'm sorry," you would start. Seeing that she was stopping and listening you would continue, "I didn't realize that I was trespassing or anything. I didn't know there was a need for an escort.... er.... here." He would motion on the road. You would start to continue to explain but she would cut you off.

She would scoff, "Just like a typical human to not pay attention to the rules, even the ones they signed in the treaty!" She would point to the forest, "Just because those long ears gave you permission to build a road on 'our' territory, doesn't mean that we are happy about it." He tail would flick in frustration, "That's why we set up the 'escort' service. Those not under escort are to pay a fine or be imprisoned for no less than 14 days to the herd!"

Hearing this you would gasp, now knowing that your freedom could be potentially at stake, and you feared what imprisonment to a herd would be like.

"Please," you all but shout, "Let me explain..."
12532.title: She would call out to you (Stern)

choices: She believes you but you still broke the law
She doesn't believe you and thinks you mock her
125321.content:
She would stop clearly hearing the plea in your voice. Smirking she would state, "Fine, but you better have a good reason for trespassing or else I'm going to add a week to your sentence!"

Quickly you would tell her of your crash and where you were from, "Look I don't even know how I got here. I was just riding my bike," you would motion to your scrap of what used to be a motorcycle, "and then all of a sudden I'm on this road, in the middle of nowhere, talking to you ma'am." You hoped to whatever god would listen that she would hear the sincerity in your voice and see reason.

You watch as she mulls over what you just told her before responding....
125321.title: She hears you out

info.brief_description: In this you are a Male Human who has been brought over to another world that resembles D&D
info.description:
You're not sure what happened. One minute you're cruising down the blacktop on your new bike, the next there a clap of thunder, a flash of pitch black, and you are staring at your bike in pieces next to a cobblestone road. Once you check your body, you would find that you are relatively unharmed, though you feel like you've ran a marathon.

Rules:

1.) This is a Fantasy world so almost anything can happen, however there must always be a way 'out' for the adventurer.
2.) No death before 10 chapters.
3.) Unless under a 'More' or 'something else' chapter please have at least 100 characters
4.) Have fun
info.pretty_title: Isekai to a Dungeons and Dragons realm
